intro: Lasiandra villosissima, commonly known as the woolly lasiandra, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are typically ovate to elliptical in shape and covered in fine, soft hairs. Lasiandra villosissima is often found in rocky or sandy soils in arid or semi-arid regions.
